required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PD-1 Inhibitor and Nab-paclitaxel and Bevacizumab in CUP
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 2, Open-label, Single Center, Prospective Study of Recombinant Humanized Anti-PD-1 Monoclonal Antibody Combined With Nab-paclitaxel and Bevacizumab in the Second-line Treatment of Patients With Cancer of Unknown Primary (CUP)

brief_summary.textblock: This trial is a single-center, prospective, single-arm Phase II clinical study. The purpose is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of recombinant humanized anti-PD-1 monoclonal antibody combined with albumin paclitaxel and bevacizumab in the second-line treatment of patients with unknown primary tumors.

detailed_description.textblock: Recombinant humanized anti-PD-1 monoclonal antibody combined with albumin paclitaxel and bevacizumab treatment, once every 3 weeks, treatment until disease progression, intolerable adverse reactions, patient death or withdrawal informed agree.After treatment, the patients was followed up every 9 weeks for follow-up treatment and survival.

primary_outcome.measure: objective response rate (ORR) was assessed using RECIST1.1 and IRECIST standards.

arm_group.description: Recombinant humanized anti-PD-1 monoclonal antibody injection:200mg once every 3 weeks

intervention.intervention_name: Recombinant humanized anti-PD-1 monoclonal antibody injection

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of department of medical oncology
